body_html:
@peterjc123
Thanks,
I did use torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False. in my code, which resolved the problem, but I wonder why I can not use cudnn on windows with PyTorch?

The most problematic issue is with using CNN's, the code crashes (python internal error) without any stack trace. It would be great if you can run the code, it is available here:
https://github.com/QuantScientist/Deep-Learning-Boot-Camp/blob/master/day02-PyTORCH-and-PyCUDA/PyTorch/55-PyTorch-using-CONV1D-on-one-dimensional-data-CNN.ipynb

The part that crashes is in training.

body:
@peterjc123 
Thanks, 
I did use torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False. in my code, which resolved the problem, but I wonder why I can not use cudnn on windows with PyTorch?

The most problematic issue is with using CNN's, the code crashes (python internal error) without any stack trace. It would be great if you can run the code, it is available here:
https://github.com/QuantScientist/Deep-Learning-Boot-Camp/blob/master/day02-PyTORCH-and-PyCUDA/PyTorch/55-PyTorch-using-CONV1D-on-one-dimensional-data-CNN.ipynb

The part that crashes is in training.
